title: Tiny Recursive Models: Less is More for AI Reasoning
description: How a 7-million parameter network outperforms trillion-parameter LLMs on reasoning benchmarks — by thinking again, and again, and again.

notebooks.title: Recursive Reasoning Fundamentals: Why Thinking Again Beats Thinking Bigger
Building the Tiny Recursive Model Architecture from Scratch
Deep Supervision Training: Teaching a Tiny Model to Reason
Ablation Studies: What Really Matters in Recursive Reasoning?

caseStudy.title: Edge-Deployed Wafer Defect Pattern Classification Using Recursive Reasoning
caseStudy.subtitle: Section 1: Industry Context and Business Problem
caseStudy.description: SilicaAI's current defect classification model is a cloud-based convolutional neural network (CNN) with 45 million parameters. It achieves 89% accuracy on their internal benchmark, which is acceptable but not market-leading. However, the real problem is **latency and reliability**:

curator.name: Dr. Rajat Dandekar
curator.title: Course Instructor
curator.bio: Dr. Rajat Dandekar is a researcher and educator specializing in AI/ML, with a passion for making complex concepts accessible through intuitive explanations and hands-on learning.
